title: ITC Lubalin Graph by Elsner+Flake vs ITC Lubalin Graph
content:
Hi I am curious about the difference of the 2 versions ITC Lubalin Graph made by... is it simply licencing, is one better than the other, one more meticulous than the other?

ITC Lubalin Graph by Elsner+Flake (on FontShop)  
 [http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/elsner\_flake/itc\_lubalin\_graph\_bol...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706175256/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/elsner_flake/itc_lubalin_graph_bold/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/elsner\_flake/itc\_lubalin\_graph\_bold/")

vs

ITC Lubalin Graph (on Monotype)  
 [http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=425731&gclid=CLeZw-6wqJMCF...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706175256/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=425731&gclid=CLeZw-6wqJMCFR0ZagodZhYAoA "http://www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=425731&gclid=CLeZw-6wqJMCFR0ZagodZhYAoA")

thanks

 [‹ Font name different in InDesign](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706175256/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45340 "Go to previous forum topic") [Georgian ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706175256/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45401 "Go to next forum topic")
author: concrete

comments.content: well I have found out the difference... and there is a difference not in the outline or the structure of the typeface...
IIRC Elsner+Flake own different data than that owned by Monotype so there will be subtle differences. I know Monotype seems to have more of the ligatures for Avant Garde than those of Elsner+Flake.
